Package com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    FutureCommandResult
    Supplier of the command result which additionally allows to check if the command already terminated.
    Killable
    Implementations encapsulate a running process that can be killed.
    KillableObserver
    Implementations of this interface observe, and potentially kill, a Killable object.
    Subprocess
    A process started by Bazel.
    Subprocess.Factory
    Something that can create subprocesses.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Command
    Represents an executable command, including its arguments and runtime environment (environment variables, working directory).
    CommandBuilder
    Implements OS aware Command builder.
    CommandResult
    Encapsulates the results of a command execution, including exit status and output to stdout and stderr.
    InputStreamSink
    Provides sinks for input streams.
    JavaSubprocessFactory
    A subprocess factory that uses ProcessBuilder.
    Preconditions
    Like Preconditions, but with overloads that avoid varargs-based array creation in Preconditions.checkArgument(boolean), Preconditions.checkState(boolean), and Preconditions.checkNotNull(T) for calls that list up to seven error message arguments when expression is true (or reference is non-null).
    ShellUtils
    Utility functions for Bourne shell commands, including escaping and tokenizing.
    SubprocessBuilder
    A builder class that starts a subprocess.
    TerminationStatus
    Represents the termination status of a command.
    TimeoutKillableObserver
    KillableObserver implementation which will kill its observed Killable if it is still being observed after a given amount of time has elapsed.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    OS
    Detects the running operating system and returns a describing enum value.
    SubprocessBuilder.StreamAction
    What to do with an output stream of the process.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    AbnormalTerminationException
    Thrown when a command's execution terminates abnormally -- for example, if it is killed, or if it terminates with a non-zero exit status.
    BadExitStatusException
    Thrown when a command's execution terminates with a non-zero exit status.
    CommandException
    Superclass of all exceptions that may be thrown during command execution.
    ExecFailedException
    Thrown when a command could not even be executed by the JVM -- in particular, when Runtime.exec(String[]) fails.
    ShellUtils.TokenizationException
    Thrown by tokenize method if there is an error
